message.content:
It is difficult to definitively say whether soap or hand sanitizer is better, as both are effective at reducing the spread of germs and bacteria when used properly. The key difference lies in the specific circumstances in which each one performs best.

Soap:

- Soap and water effectively remove dirt, grease, and various chemicals from your hands. Washing your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds helps to reduce the number of microbes on your hands.
- In situations where you have visible dirt or grime on your hands or have been handling harmful chemicals or pesticides, soap is more effective than hand sanitizer.
- Regular use of soap may also be less irritating to skin than frequent use of alcohol-based sanitizers.

Hand Sanitizer:

- Hand sanitizers are convenient when you do not have access to soap and water. Hand sanitizers containing at least 60% alcohol are able to kill many types of germs quickly.
- It does not work well against norovirus (stomach flu
